item.title: First Occurence of Wandering Salamander on the Sunshine Coast of British Columbia
item.description: Glenn R. Ryder and R. Wayne Campbell The wandering salamander (Aneides vagrans) (Figure 1), formerly known as the clouded salamander (A. ferreus), occurs at low elevations on Vancouver Island and some adjacent offshore islands. Although it occurs in Oregon, there are no records from mainland Washington and only a few scattered historical records for the extreme southwest mainland coast of British Columbia. (Green and Campbell 1984; Corkran and Thoms 1996). The status of this species outside Vancouver Island is not well known.
